title: Mobile-Based Self-Regulated English Learning Competency Strengthening Program: Developing Digital Citizenship and Global Communication Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English grammar and expression comprehension, fundamental digital device operation, and understanding of basic digital citizenship (online etiquette, information ethics, etc.)
context.additional_context: Blended learning environments utilizing digital devices such as smartphones and tablets. Promoting self-directed learning through peer coaching and gamification. Emphasizing social learning contexts for global communication competencies and digital citizenship

learning_goals: Learners can establish and execute an English learning plan using a mobile app at least three times weekly, fostering self-directed learning habits to enhance global communication competencies.

Learners can complete one 3–5-minute English mini-project using digital storytelling techniques (video, infographics, podcasts, etc.), achieve a grade of 'B' (80+ points) in at least three of the five peer evaluation rubric items, and improve digital citizenship and intercultural communication skills.
Learners can master 200 target vocabulary items within three months through gamified assignments and cultivate collaborative problem-solving skills in the language learning process.
Learners can experience social interaction and community-based learning culture by serving as feedback providers at least twice in peers’ English learning processes through peer coaching.

resources: E-Portfolio System for Learning Outcome Documentation

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
